data.prompt:
Create a watercolor-inspired visualization. Aspect ratio 16:9 (1920x1080). Use soft, blended colors with gentle transitions (watercolor palette: soft blues, pinks, yellows). Colorful textured background with watercolor wash effects (light blues blending into soft pinks or yellows). Elements should blend naturally at edges while maintaining distinct forms that represent the concept. ALL ELEMENTS CENTERED, artistic composition. Gentle, artistic aesthetic. CRITICAL: NO text, NO characters, NO labels, NO numbers. Mathematically accurate representation only.


ABSOLUTELY NO TEXT ALLOWED - ZERO TOLERANCE:
- NO text, NO letters, NO numbers, NO words, NO labels
- NO subtopic names (like "Addition", "Fractions", "Geometry")
- NO year levels (like "Year 1", "Year 7")
- NO titles, NO captions, NO annotations
- NO mathematical notation or symbols written as text
- The image MUST be 100% VISUAL ONLY - pure geometric shapes and forms
- If you're tempted to add text, DON'T - use visual representation instead


representing the mathematical subtopic "Calendar Interpretation, year 3" designed for Year 8 students.

CRITICAL CONTENT REQUIREMENTS:
- The image MUST show ONLY what is directly relevant to "Calendar Interpretation, year 3" - NOTHING ELSE
- Show the SINGLE most essential visual element that represents "Calendar Interpretation, year 3"
- Use MINIMAL abstract geometric shapes - only what is absolutely essential
- NO unnecessary decorative elements, NO extra shapes, NO unrelated objects
- Focus on the CORE CONCEPT ONLY - strip away everything non-essential
- Ensure the representation is age-appropriate for Year 8

ULTRA-SPECIFIC RELEVANCE RULES:
- For "Calendar": Show ONLY a simple calendar grid - NO scales, NO clocks, NO charts
- For "Time": Show ONLY a simple clock face - NO calendars, NO other time-related objects
- For "Cartesian Plane": Show ONLY x and y axes with maybe a single point - NO graphs, NO extra elements
- For "Simultaneous Linear Equations": Show ONLY two intersecting straight lines - NO axes labels, NO extra decorations
- For "Fractions": Show ONLY divided shapes representing parts of a whole - NO unrelated shapes
- For "Angles": Show ONLY angle formation with two rays - NO protractors, NO extra geometric shapes
- For "Calendar Interpretation, year 3": Show ONLY the core visual element that represents this specific concept

WHAT TO AVOID - COMMON MISTAKES:
- DO NOT add scales, rulers, or measuring tools unless the subtopic is specifically about measurement
- DO NOT add clocks unless the subtopic is specifically about time
- DO NOT add calendars unless the subtopic is specifically about calendars/dates
- DO NOT add pie charts, bar graphs, or data visualizations unless the subtopic is specifically about that type of graph
- DO NOT add multiple unrelated mathematical objects in one image
- DO NOT add decorative geometric shapes that don't relate to "Calendar Interpretation, year 3"
- Ask yourself: "Does this element DIRECTLY represent Calendar Interpretation, year 3?" If NO, remove it!

MINIMALISM GUIDELINES:
- Use 1-3 key elements maximum (often just 1 is enough!)
- Each element must DIRECTLY and SPECIFICALLY relate to "Calendar Interpretation, year 3"
- Avoid complexity - extreme simplicity is key
- Remove anything that doesn't help explain "Calendar Interpretation, year 3" specifically
- Think: "What is the ONE thing that shows Calendar Interpretation, year 3?"

CRITICAL CENTERING REQUIREMENTS:
- ALL elements MUST be positioned at the EXACT CENTER of the image
- Perfect VERTICAL centering - elements centered top to bottom
- Perfect HORIZONTAL centering - elements centered left to right
- The main visual should be in the DEAD CENTER of the composition
- NO elements near edges, corners, or off-center positions
- Create a balanced, symmetrical composition around the center point
- Generous empty space on ALL SIDES (top, bottom, left, right)

FINAL REMINDER - NO TEXT & ONLY RELEVANT ELEMENTS:
- Do NOT include the subtopic name "Calendar Interpretation, year 3" as text
- Do NOT include the year level "Year 8" as text
- Do NOT include ANY words or labels
- Do NOT include elements unrelated to "Calendar Interpretation, year 3"
- Show ONLY what is directly relevant to "Calendar Interpretation, year 3"
- Use ONLY visual geometric representations

Create a paper-craft style illustration. Aspect ratio 16:9 (1920x1080). Use flat colors with clear layer separation and subtle drop shadows (4-5 colors). Soft gradient background in gentle pastel tones (light blue to cream or soft pink to peach). Elements should appear as cut paper or cardboard layers that represent the mathematical concept. CENTERED COMPOSITION with depth through layering. Friendly, tactile aesthetic. CRITICAL: NO text, NO labels, NO numbers, NO characters. Precise geometric representation only.


ABSOLUTELY NO TEXT ALLOWED - ZERO TOLERANCE:
- NO text, NO letters, NO numbers, NO words, NO labels
- NO subtopic names (like "Addition", "Fractions", "Geometry")
- NO year levels (like "Year 1", "Year 7")
- NO titles, NO captions, NO annotations
- NO mathematical notation or symbols written as text
- The image MUST be 100% VISUAL ONLY - pure geometric shapes and forms
- If you're tempted to add text, DON'T - use visual representation instead
